10 Mar 2017

Setting Aliases In Windows Git Bash Profile

If you have a Windows computer and use a Git Bash to company you while you code, there are some shortcuts you need to know about.

To set up your profile, you have to first go to your home directory with cd then creating a file in that directory called .bashrc . $ cd $ touch .bashrc You can now edit it using vim

$ vim .bashrc

or just open it in your folder and then open it in your favorite editor if you don’t have a editor shortcut set up with your git bash.

$ start .bashrc

Now once it’s open on your favorite editor, you can set aliases

alias workspace="cd ~/your-directory-path"

Now save this by typing

$ source .bashrc

for example I have a Workspace for where I write all my code and I have an alias $ workspace which will immediately cd me into that directory.

alias workspace="cd ~/Documents/Workspace/"

And there you go. Hope you now have alias in your Windows Git Bash profile.
